body_html:
Hi @byronyi,
We did some benchmarks lately, but I don't recall seeing the exact issue you are seeing.
can u specify the test and cluster spec being used?

I'm seeing a different issue, tf_cnn_benchmark gets stuck when the scale is >=4 nodes (with 8 gpus each) and working with real ImageNet data. This happens in IB as well as RoCE.
Not clear what is the issue yet, the RDMA connections looks ok.
Anyway, I'll open a different issue for it, and I'll update there on the findings.

Did u got more information when running with TF_CPP_MIN_VLOG_LEVEL=2 ?
It's a lot of verbosity (all the VLOG(2) prints) but maybe can add good data.

body:
Hi @byronyi, 
We did some benchmarks lately, but I don't recall seeing the exact issue you are seeing.
can u specify the test and cluster spec being used? 

I'm seeing a different issue, tf_cnn_benchmark gets stuck when the scale is >=4 nodes (with 8 gpus each) and working with real ImageNet data. This happens in IB as well as RoCE.
Not clear what is the issue yet, the RDMA connections looks ok.
Anyway, I'll open a different issue for it, and I'll update there on the findings.

Did u got more information when running with TF_CPP_MIN_VLOG_LEVEL=2 ? 
It's a lot of verbosity (all the VLOG(2) prints) but maybe can add good data.
